required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Computerized Cognitive Training in Middle-Aged Adults With Generalized Anxiety Disorder: A Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Computerized Cognitive Training in Middle-Aged Adults With Generalized Anxiety Disorder: A Pilot Study (COGMA)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to look at the effects of computerized cognitive training on anxiety, sleep, mental abilities (cognition), and other aspects of daytime functioning, such as arousal.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomly assigned to cognitive training or trivia training and will complete measures of anxiety, sleep, cognition (objective, self-efficacy), and self-reported arousal at baseline, and post-intervention

primary_outcome.description: Complete computerized tasks. These tasks will measure cognitive functions (e.g., processing speed).
Complete computerized tasks. These tasks will measure cognitive functions (e.g., attention).
Complete computerized tasks. These tasks will measure cognitive functions (e.g., executive function).
A 25-item questionnaire. Participants rate from 0 (never) to 4 (very often) frequency of cognitive errors. Higher scores indicate lower cognitive self-efficacy.
5- item questionnaire that assess anxiety related to the Coronavirus.

Inventory that asks respondents to rate how true 20 self-descriptive statements (e.g., I feel calm) are on a 4-point scale (1 = not at all, 4 = very much so). Typically, respondents are asked to rate statements according to how they generally feel (trait-anxiety scale) and how they feel in the current moment (state-anxiety scale). Total scores range from 20 to 80, with higher scores indicating greater maladjustment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Game-related experience- Sessions and duration played
secondary_outcome.description: During the intervention phase the cognitive training group will play games and will need to log the days and duration played.

secondary_outcome.measure: Circadian Rhythm- Morningness-Eveningness Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: 19-item questionnaire that assesses preference for morning, afternoon, and evening activities. Total score reflects degree of "morningness" or "eveningness" type.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Arousal- Global Cognitive Arousal-Perceived Stress Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived Stress Scale is a self-report measure of how life situations are perceived as stressful. The scale consists of 15 items corresponding to everyday situation and participants are asked to rate on a likert scale from 0 (never) to 4 (very often) how often they felt or thought a specific way. Higher scores correspond to higher perceived stress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Arousal- Pre-sleep Arousal Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Pre-sleep Arousal Scale is a 16-item self-report questionnaire comprising both cognitive and somatic manifestations of arousal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Arousal- Arousal Predisposition Scale Subjective Arousal- Arousal Predisposition Scale Subjective Arousal- Arousal Predisposition Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Arousal Predisposition Scale is a 12-item inventory that has been designed to measure the degree to which an individual experiences arousal. Higher scores indicate greater predisposition to arousal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Game Engagement Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire assessing the experience of the game.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mood-Depression-Beck Depression Inventory-II
secondary_outcome.description: 21-item inventory that asks respondents to rate on a scale of 0 (no depressive feelings) to 3 (most depressive feelings) their feelings towards various aspects of daily living/situations. Higher total scores indicate worse depressive symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Alcohol Use - Alcohol Use Disorder Test
secondary_outcome.description: 10-item questionnaire that assess the frequency of alcohol use and problems associated with alcohol use over the past year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Activity - International Physical Activity Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: 7- item questionnaire assessing the different kinds of physical activities that the participant does as pat of their everyday life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Personality - Big Five Inventory
secondary_outcome.description: 10 question assessment measuring personality.

secondary_outcome.measure: COVID-19 related media exposure and risk questions
secondary_outcome.description: 20- item questionnaire assessing the effects of news and social media on perception of COVID-19.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Intervention Efficacy- Internet Intervention Utility Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: 16- item questionnaire about the use of the intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Computer Proficiency- Computer Proficiency Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: This questionnaire asks about participants' ability to perform a number of tasks with a computer. Will be examined as a covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Behavioral Sleep- Insomnia Severity Index
secondary_outcome.description: Brief self-report measure of current perception of insomnia symptom severity, distress and daytime impairment. Commonly used in insomnia treatment outcome research.

secondary_outcome.measure: Beck Depression Inventory-2nd Edition
secondary_outcome.description: 21-item inventory that asks respondents to rate on a scale of 0 (no depressive feelings) to 3 (most depressive feelings) their feelings towards various aspects of daily living/situations. Higher total scores indicate worse depressive symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Behavioral Sleep - Electronic Daily Sleep Diaries
secondary_outcome.description: Online diaries completed each morning (~5 mins); diaries measure sleep onset latency, wake time after sleep onset, total sleep time, and sleep quality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Behavioral Sleep - Electronic Daily Sleep Diaries
secondary_outcome.description: Online diaries completed each morning (~5 mins); diaries measure sleep onset latency

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Behavioral Sleep - Electronic Daily Sleep Diaries
secondary_outcome.description: Online diaries completed each morning (~5 mins); diaries measure wake time after sleep onset

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Behavioral Sleep - Electronic Daily Sleep Diaries
secondary_outcome.description: Online diaries completed each morning (~5 mins); diaries measure total sleep time

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Behavioral Sleep - Electronic Daily Sleep Diaries
secondary_outcome.description: Online diaries completed each morning (~5 mins); diaries measure sleep quality

intervention.description: Participants (n=15) will complete computerized cognitive training games and activities online 3 times/week for 8 weeks.
Participants (n=15) will receive computerized trivia questions to answer and submit 3 times/week for 8 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 45-59 yrs of age
- no neurological or psychiatric illness, dementia, or loss of consciousness > 5 mins
- nongamers (i.e., report <1 hour of video/cognitive training games/week over last 2 yrs)
- proficient in English (reading and writing)
- computer meets technology requirements (i.e. Windows: Windows 7 or above using Internet Explorer 11 or Edge, Mozilla Firefox 41 and above, Google Chrome 48 and above; Mac OS: Mac OS X v10.8 and above using Safari 10 and above, Mozilla Firefox 42 and above, Google Chrome 48 and above; Android App: Android 6 or higher version; iOS App: iOS 10 or higher version
- meet clinical dx criteria for Generalized Anxiety Disorder.
Exclusion Criteria:
- unable to provide informed consent
- unable to undergo randomization
- Telephone Interview for Cognitive Status-modified (TICS) score <33, 2)
- other sleep disorder (i.e., sleep apnea, Periodic Limb Movement Disorder-PLMD, narcolepsy, REM Sleep Behavior Disorder)
- severe untreated psychiatric comorbidity that renders randomization unethical
- psychotropic, anxiolytic medications or other medications(e.g., beta-blockers) that alter mood or sleep
- uncorrected visual/auditory impairments
- participation in nonpharmacological treatment for sleep/fatigue/mood outside the current study.

overall_official.affiliation: University of Missouri- School of Medicine
